snippet: The commission has begun an investigation of Internet service providers at the same time that it is trying to define whether it has jurisdiction over their businesses.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission opens investigation into deal where entertainment companies like Netflix have agreed to pay Internet service providers like Comcast and Verizon for faster video delivery; critics contend practice will divide Internet into fast and slow lanes.
lead_paragraph: The commission has begun an investigation of Internet service providers at the same time that it is trying to define whether it has jurisdiction over their businesses.

headline.main: F.C.C. Begins Investigation Into Quality of Internet Download Speeds
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Begins Investigation Into Quality of Internet Download Speeds
